Nicholas Clarke <nicl@...> writes:

> However I would like to be able to get a list of the warc headers in a
> record and also a copy of the complete header as a byte array.

Hmm, I don't think you can get the warc headers as a byte array.  The
code that parses the headers out of the underlying byte stream consumes
those bytes from the stream so that the file pointer is at the end of
the warc headers once they are parsed.

I'm curious, what do you want to do with the bytes of the warc headers,
if you were able to get them?


Aaron
